parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The post focuses on waste management infrastructure in Ploiești.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content discusses a topic of public interest (waste management) relevant to the residents of Ploiești.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to inform the public about the progress and future plans for waste management infrastructure in Ploiești. There is no discernible attempt to influence voting behavior for any candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information in a manner consistent with citizen journalism or a public service announcement. It focuses on factual information and does not contain persuasive language or calls to action related to any election.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>True. While the post expresses an opinion on the need for improved waste management, it does not advocate for or against any specific candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3785882985075754</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, focusing on waste management infrastructure in Ploiești, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  It lacks any direct or indirect reference to parliamentary candidates or parties. The content is informative, addressing a matter of public concern, and presented in a neutral, non-persuasive manner. The paid advertisement format does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda; the content itself must meet the criteria outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  This post does not fulfill the criteria for electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
